bibl.title: Fever chart for William H. Hart, [1900]

div1.head: Fever chart for William H. Hart, [1900]
div1.p:
Previous history: Saturday morning patient had had some pain in muscles & joints, that afternoon chilli-
ness, but no a t chill - headache moderately severe. Constipation. Saw him that
evening & advised Epsom Salts [quantity].
Probable source and nature of infection:

Sunday morning 3 p.m.A.M. Called in to see patient and found him to have intense pain
in the chest especially region heart. Patient had been vomiting just previous to my
seeing him, colorless fluid pulse very rapid & especially so respiration headache intense.
Following day rash on chest, papular in form, very itchy but differing from measles in
that it lacked the crescentic arrangement. That on chest has already on 3d day begun
desquamated, these also bring branny & not unlike that of measles. Though rash considerably
increased, especially during period of defervescence 98.6 [degrees] after which it increased, still more, on legs.
During this defervescence pain absent. The same night temperature again
rose to 101 & with it a decided increase in muscular & joint pain with the exception
of the chest pains which did not reappear after the morphine of the first night
This case was not so typical as some of the others, in as much as the rash
appeared on the second day rather than at the defeverescence and prostration at
that period trifling compared with others. Slight stomatitis & conjunctivitis
yielded to usual remedyies
Treatment Kept bowels regular - Easily digestible diet. and.
